qas.question: In what geographic area was the country of India established?
What did the joining of the Indus Valley and Indo-Aryan cultures produce?
Of what is Hinduism a combination?
How long was the succession of powerful dynasties in the Indian subcontinent?
What movement lead to the founding of the Republic of India?

context: The history of India includes the prehistoric settlements and societies in the <a0_0>Indian subcontinent<a0_0/>; the blending of the Indus Valley Civilization and Indo-Aryan culture into the <a1_0>Vedic Civilization<a1_0/>; the development of Hinduism as a synthesis of various <a2_0>Indian cultures and traditions<a2_0/>; the rise of the Śramaṇa movement; the decline of Śrauta sacrifices and the birth of the initiatory traditions of Jainism, Buddhism, Shaivism, Vaishnavism and Shaktism; the onset of a succession of powerful dynasties and empires for more than <a3_0>two millennia<a3_0/> throughout various geographic areas of the subcontinent, including the growth of Muslim dynasties during the Medieval period intertwined with Hindu powers; the advent of European traders resulting in the establishment of the British rule; and the subsequent <a4_0>independence movement<a4_0/> that led to the Partition of India and the creation of the Republic of India.
